result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon L Loggins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).
  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
* PAY restitution in full - to be determined at the upcoming restitution hearing on August 26, 2016..  THIS IS TO BE PAID FIRST.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

**** 8-26-2016, Judge Jeffrey Conen; Restitution Hearing, The Court set restitution in this matter at ZERO.****

EACH COUNT: PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA sample be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Consecutive to: consecutive to Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6.
Credit given for 372 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: * Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Credit given for ZERO days time served.

Defendant Devon L Loggins in court (via video) with Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant Devon L Loggins in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Status Conference.  Matter is here to correct the record from the Defendant's Jury Trial.  When the Court polled the jury, one juror (juror #14) was not polled, only 11 jurors were polled.  Juror #14 was present, via telephone, for this hearing.  The Court had colloquy with the Juror about his jury deliberations.  Juror #14 indicated he did participate in jury deliberations and the GUILTY verdicts were his verdicts.  The Court corrected the record to reflect that Juror #14 agreed with the verdicts.  Attorney Wasielewski will draft an Order for the Court to sign for purposes of a clean record for the Court of Appeals.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Devon L Loggins not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Status Conference.  Parties met privately with the Court in chambers.  Matter set for a status conference on September 12, 2017 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court. The respective juror will be calling in and the Defendant will be appearing by video to clear up an issue.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE CONEN FOR JUDGE DONALD.....
Defendant Devon L Loggins in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Devon L Loggins in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  2 changes made to the PSI as set forth on the record.  Statements made by the State and defense.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 30 YEARS, consecutive to Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 20 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.
Credit given for 372 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 30 YEARS, consecutive to Counts 1, 3, 4, 5, and 6.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 20 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served. 

AS TO COUNT 3:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS, consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 4, 5, and 6.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.  

AS TO COUNT 4:   The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS, consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 3, 5, and 6.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 5:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS, consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, and 6.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 6:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS, concurrent to Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, & 6):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* PAY restitution in full - to be determined at the upcoming restitution hearing.  THIS IS TO BE PAID FIRST.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA sample be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

**Case adjourned to Judge Conen's upcoming rotation calendar on 08-26-2016 at 1:30 PM - Br. 15, Judge Watts' Court for Restitution Hearing.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE CONEN FOR JUDGE DONALD.....
Defendant Devon L Loggins in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Devon L Loggins in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


At the hour of 1:41 PM the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts as follows:  

Count 1:  GUILTY
Count 2:  GUILTY
Count 3:  GUILTY
Count 4:  GUILTY
Count 5:  GUILTY
Count 6:  GUILTY


which was then read.  
Court polled and discharged the jury.  
Verdicts received and filed. 
Jury released from service.
Jury out of box at 1:46 PM.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdicts.  
Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, & 6.

Upon defense request, Court ordered a PSI without a recommendation.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

**Judge Conen RETAINED this case for purposes of sentencing.

Case adjourned to 07-01-2016 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

**Judge Conen sitting in Judge Donald's courtroom on the next court date.

Court instructed jury.  
Closing arguments by state and defense.  
Court charged the jury.  
Alternate jurors selected by lot and released.  
Jury retired at the hour of 12:30 PM to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Pelowski and Gaudynski who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Court addressed a housekeeping matter:  Upon State's motion, Court dismissed the "Party to a Crime" charge as to all counts as stated in the Amended Complaint.

Time is now 4:57 PM and court must conclude for the day.

Court instructed jury to return tomorrow at 8:30 AM to continue their deliberations.
Jury out of box at 5:00 PM.

Court finds defendant made a choice to testify.
